description.narrative: Low-emissions and climate resilience objectives are integrated into development policies/plans in six EaP countries through improved and consolidated climate policies and legislative alignment.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: (i) Status of nationally determined contributions, national mid-century strategies and NAPs communicated to the UNFCCC in 6 EaP countries; (ii) Level of institutional capacities in the six EaP countries for the implementation of the Paris Agreement; (iii) Level of alignment with EU acquis as provided by bilateral agreements with EU and in the framework of Energy Community Treaty; (iv) Level of mobilization of new climate finance resources by countries (including under NIF/NIP) since the start of the project, EUR.

comment.narrative: i - The National Inception Workshop ii - Registration of the project required by the national legislature

i - On 24 May 2019, the National Inception Workshop offered an opportunity for the government officials and the representatives of various stakeholder groups to discuss priorities and next steps for “EU4Climate” implementation in Belarus. EU4Climate was presented as a new project to tackle climate change in Belarus. ii - Registration of the project was prolonged to then next year - 2020.

i. Update 2nd Nationally Determined Contribution of Belarus ii. Launch the process of LEDS development iii. Launch the national gap analysis and roadmap for the EU4Climate assistance on providing recommendations on the national policy alignment with EU climate acquis iv. Launch gap analysis of the climate change mainstreaming into the existing legislation and strategic plans for the specified sectors (at least two sectors) v. At least two sectors are identified for mainstreaming climate change into sectoral guidelines vi. Analysis of current institutional framework, coordination, monitoring, reporting and communication mechanisms for climate adaptation vii. Recruitment of the personal for the Project Implementation Unit viii. Communication campaign started ix. One National Coordination Project Board is held x. National Annual Work Plan 2020 is developed xi. National part of the regional Annual Work Plan 2020 is integrated into the regional Annual Work Plan 2020 xii. National budget revision is shared with the Regional component xiii. Annual Progress report 2020 is complete xiv. National Annual Work Plan 2021 is developed xv. National part of the regional Annual Work Plan 2021 is developed and shared to be integrated into the Regional Annual Work Plan 2021 xvi. Registration of the project required by the national legislature

i. Needed analysis to identify possible scenarios for the 2nd NDC was prepared and shared with the sectoral ministries for consultations and formulation of the updated climate commitment target ii. Assessment of the national status of LEDS launched. The contract with the Individual Consultant to carry out the activities was signed on 23 November. - Thirteen Belarussian representatives (9 women and 4 men) from the Ministries of Natural Resources and Environment Protection, Energy, Economy, Housing, Transport and Communications, and Aviation of the Ministry of Transport and Communications took part in the regional webinar that was held in Zoom on 19-20 October 2020 iii. Analysis report of the national legislation with EU climate acquis has started by the National Consultant and the Environment Agency Austria in Q4 2020. The reports shall be ready in 2021 iv. The contract with the Individual Consultant to carry out the activities related to the gap analysis of existing legislation and strategic plans in the waste sector was signed on 27 November 2020. The results will be ready in Q1 2021. v. Two sectors were identified for mainstreaming climate change into sectoral guidelines: waste (during the working e-meeting held on 30 October) and energy (specified in the project document as a priority sector). The identified sectors were confirmed through official correspondence held in December between UNDP and MNREP vi. The contract with the Individual Consultant to carry out the activities related to the analysis of current institutional framework, coordination, monitoring, reporting and communication mechanisms for climate adaptation was signed on 27 November. The results will be ready in Q1 2021 - Six Belarussian representatives (3 women and 3 men) from the Ministries of Natural Resources and Environment Protection, Emergency, Health, Agriculture and Food, Housing, and Forestry took part in the regional webinar that was held in Zoom on 18-19 November 2020 on National Adaptation Strategies and Plans vii. Complete recruitment of the personal for the Project Implementation Unit a. National Coordinator joined the project on 10 February 2020 b. Administrative and Finance Assistant joined the project on 31 August 2020 c. PR and Communication Specialist joined the project on 11 November 2020 viii. Communication campaign started a. Project brief was prepared b. Complete terms of reference for the production of the thematic videos about the project (Paris Agreement, climate change, NDC) ix. Due to the pandemic, the board was not held in 2020; the meetings needed for the project’s implementation were held on-line x. National Annual Work Plan 2020 was prepared in September, duly agreed and cleared with MNREP and UNDP CO in October, and signed on 5 November xi. National part of the regional Annual Work Plan 2020 was integrated into the regional Annual Work Plan 2020 xii. National budget revision was shared with the Regional project in Q3 2020 xiii. Annual Progress report 2020 was complete and shared for clearance with UNDP on 21 December xiv. National Annual Work Plan 2021 was developed in December 2020 xv. National part of the regional Annual Work Plan 2021 was shared to be integrated into the Regional Annual Work Plan 2021 xvi. The national part of the regional project EU4Climate was registered in the database of the International Technical Assistance Programs and Projects of the Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Belarus under the № 2/20/001094 on July 27, 2020.

i. Second Nationally Determined Contribution of the Republic of Belarus updated ii. Number of consultations held to support submission of second Nationally Determined Contribution iii. National low emissions development of the energy sector assessed against economy-wide, sector-specific, social, environmental, technological capacity, and financial needs criterion iv. Policy alignment and development of recommendations on the alignment of the national policy with EU acquis on ozone depleting substances, fluorinated greenhouse gases and air quality protection and industrial emissions complete v. A comprehensive review of policies, strategies, programs and plans complete for mainstreaming climate change into the waste management sector vi. Prognosis of climate change scenarious up to 2050 and to the end of the century complete vii. Communication campaign started and operational: at least of 6 thematic videos on climate change produced, at least 10 items of promo-products developed per event held in offline or hybrid mode viii. At lease two National Coordination Project Boards held

i. Updated Second Nationally Determined Contribution of the Republic of Belarus was submitted to UNFCCC on 8 October 2021 ii. There were three offline meetings held in October, November 2020 and in February 2021 to negotiate on the updated NDC. In addition to direct consultations, there were numerous rounds when the master file with aggregated work with the analysis for the second NDC that was shared with the stakeholders, who provided comments and suggested improvements. iii. Assessment of the national low emissions development of the energy sector against economy-wide, sector-specific, social, environmental, technological capacity, and financial needs criterion was complete. iv. Two policy papers with developed recommendations on the alignment of the national policy with EU acquis on ozone depleting substances, fluorinated greenhouse gases and air quality protection and industrial emissions are developed and shared with the national partner. v. A draft of the comprehensive review of policies, strategies, programs and plans is developed for mainstreaming climate change into the waste management sector. vi. Prognosis of climate change scenarios up to 2050 and to the end of the century is complete and shared with the national partner and the expert for the use in their work of climate change assessment per sector. vii. Communication campaign include development of 8 thematic videos on climate change, 10 visibility items of promo-products developed and distributed among the participants who participated offline during the events held in a hybrid mode viii. There were three National Coordination Project Boards held in March, September and November.

i. The awareness level and buy in of the updated Nationally Determined Contribution among the targeted stakeholders (baseline – 0%, target – 50%, result – to be complete in 2023) ii. Number of capacity building events to raise awareness on the updated Nationally Determined Contribution organized (target – 5, result – to be complete in 2023) iii. Assessment of the national low emissions development of the sectors (Industrial Processes and Product Uns, Agriculture and Land Use Land Use Change and Forestry) in Belarus is complete against economy-wide, sector-specific, social, environmental, technological capacity, and financial needs criteria (target – 3, result – to be complete in 2023) iv. Number of policy papers and studies published (baseline – 0, target – 2, result – to be complete in 2023) v. Number of Action Plans mainstreaming climate change drafted (baseline – 0, target – 1, result – to be complete in 2023) vi. Number of capacity building events to raise awareness on the Climate Change Finance organized (baseline – 0, target – 1, result – to be complete in 2023) vii. Number of the Climate Change Risks, Impact and Vulnerability assessments are complete (baseline – 0, target – 7, result – to be complete in 2023) viii. Number of participants took part in the awareness-raising events (target – 200, result – to be complete in 2023) ix. At least two National Coordination Project Boards are held (target – 2, result – to be complete in 2023)
